content:
Grandmother and 
 the Smely Girl 
 
 Southern African Folktale 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Tasnem was a very beautiful girl and
 her grandmother was very kind. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Her grandmother spent many hours 
 
 making a handsome makgabe for 
 Tasnem. Tasnem loved to wear that 
 apron. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The other girls in that place were jealous
 of Tasnem’s makgabe. They thought
 
 that it would be beter to get rid of it.
 But it is a dificult thing to take a person’s
 clothes when that person is wearing
 
 them. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One morning the girls invited Tasnem to 
 
 go swiming with them in a river nearby. 
 At the river bank, they al tok of their 
 makgabes so that the cloth would not be 
 
 damaged. 
 Then they jumped into the water and 
 
 splashed around for some time. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They finished swiming. The leader of
 the jealous girls threw Tasnem’s
 makgabe into the river, near the place of
 
 a very large snake. Then al the other
 girls left Tasnem crying by the river.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The large snake heard someone 
 
 weping. He slithered out and saw the 
 beautiful Tasnem. He swalowed the 
 makgabe and Tasnem whole. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Fortunately for her, the snake did not like
 the taste of the makgabe. He spat it and
 Tasnem out. They lay on the river bank,
 
 covered with slime from the snake’s
 stomach. This slime smeled very bad.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The smely Tasnem in her smely 
 makgabe ran home to her parents. 
 
 She sang … 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Mother, open the dor for me, I am smeling; 
 
 Mother, open the dor for me, I am smeling, 
 I am smeling very bad. 
 
 
 The mother heard Tasnem’s song and ran out of the house. 
 
 
 She sang back to the girl: 
 
 
 Go away, you are smeling, 
 Go away, you are smeling, 
 Go away, you are smeling very bad. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Tasnem was very upset. 
 
 She ran of to the house of her aunt and 
 uncle. 
 They heard her singing … 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Open the dor for me, I am smeling; 
 Open the dor for me, I am smeling, 
 
 I am smeling very bad. 
 
 They ran out of their house. They sang back: 
 
 
 Go away, you are smeling, 
 
 Go away, you are smeling, 
 Go away, you are smeling very bad. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Tasnem had only her grandmother’s
 
 house to go to. Her heart was heavy. She
 thought nobody wanted to lok after a
 bad smeling girl. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But she was wrong. Her grandmother did 
 
 not send her away. 
 She washed Tasnem, and her makgabe, 
 making everything smel swetly. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Tasnem stayed with her grandmother
 
 for many years. 
 One day the son of a very rich chief
 asked Tasnem to mary him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Tasnem’s parents heard about the 
 mariage and asked her to come back to 
 
 live in their house. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Tasnem remembered how she had 
 
 smeled so bad. 
 She told them that she would never go
 back to their house. 
 
 "Parents must love their children," she
 said, "even if their children smel very
 
 bad." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Instead Tasnem invited her 
 grandmother to come and live with her in 
 
 the house of this rich chief and his son. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 17  
 
 
 
 
 The grandmother was very hapy, and very comfortable, and very important.
